com.github.draju.selrc

Class RedcapTestUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.draju.selrc.RedcapTestUtil

  • public class RedcapTestUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains utility functions for automated testing of REDCap using Selenium

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        public static int DEBUG
        Set to 1 to print debugging statements to the console. These messages are meant to track down errors only. Informative messages on test progress should be in the test class itself.

        Login as the specified REDCap user via the REDCap login form
        Parameters:

        passwd - REDCap password

        Log out by clicking the REDCap logout link

        public static void clickOnLink(java.lang.String partialLinkText)
        Find link based on link text and click it
        Parameters:
        partialLinkText - link text to search for, partial match is okay

      • loadProjectPage

        public static void loadProjectPage(int pid)
        Loads the specified REDCap Project Setup page
        Parameters:
        pid - REDCap project ID

      • selectAddNewRecord

        public static void selectAddNewRecord()
        Shortcut function to create a new record and open the first data entry form. Clicks on the "Add / Edit Records" link and the "Add New Record" button in succession. Includes wait time to allow each respective page to load.

      • selectExistingRecord

        public static void selectExistingRecord(int recNum,
                                        java.lang.String selectID)
        Clicks on the "Add / Edit Records" link and then selects specified record from the dropdown Includes wait time to allow each respective page to load
        Parameters:
        recNum - record ID to select
        selectID - HTML ID attribute for select menu since there could be 1-3 of them, Ex: "record" (if all records complete), "record_select1" (Incomplete), "record_select2" (Unverified), "record_select3" (Complete)

      • selectFormFromGrid

        public static void selectFormFromGrid(java.lang.String formName)
        Select a form to enter from the event grid based on the form name. Assumes that you are already on Event Grid page.
        Parameters:
        formName - name of form (case-sensitive) to select for data entry

      • selectFormFromSidebar

        public static void selectFormFromSidebar(java.lang.String formName)
        Select REDCap data entry form to enter from those listed in the sidebar
        Parameters:
        formName - name of data entry form to select for entry

      • getOriginalRecord

        public static void getOriginalRecord(int origPID,
                                     int origRecord,
                                     int origEventID)
        Loads REDCap data into memory for a particular combination of project ID, record ID and event ID
        Parameters:
        origPID - REDCap project ID
        origRecord - REDCap record ID
        origEventID - REDCap event ID

      • enterForm

        public static int enterForm(int origPID,
                            int origRecord,
                            int origEventID,
                            java.lang.String recVarName)
        Enters data for the current REDCap data entry form based on data that was previously entered for another record. This function should only be called after the form has been opened and ID field has been entered or auto-generated.
        Parameters:
        origPID - REDCap project ID of original record
        origRecord - REDCap record ID of original record
        origEventID - REDCap event ID of original record
        recVarName - variable that holds the participant ID number, e.g. 'record_id'
        Returns:
        the record ID for the form that was just entered or -1 on error

      • checkRecentLogEntry

        public static java.lang.Long checkRecentLogEntry(int projectID,
                                                 int pk,
                                                 int eventID,
                                                 java.lang.String sqlLog,
                                                 java.lang.String dataValues,
                                                 java.lang.String description,
                                                 java.lang.String changeReason,
                                                 java.lang.String timestamp,
                                                 int numSec)
        Looks for a matching REDCap log entry based on selection criteria and occuring within a certain number of seconds of the passed in timestamp. Allows partial matches for sqlLog, dataValues, description and changeReason. Limits query results for the redcap_log_event database table for the 10 most recent entries.
        Parameters:
        projectID - redcap_log_event.project_id field
        pk - redcap_log_event.pk field
        eventID - redcap_log_event.event_id
        sqlLog - redcap_log_event.sql_log
        dataValues - redcap_log_event.data_values field
        description - redcap_log_event.description field
        changeReason - redcap_log_event.change_reason field
        timestamp - passed in timestamp to compare against redcap_log_event.ts field
        numSec - number of seconds allowance that timestamp varies from redcap_log_event.ts field
        Returns:
        value of redcap_log_event.log_event_id field for the matching REDCap log entry or -1 if no matching entry found

      • waitAndHandlePopup

        public static void waitAndHandlePopup(WebDriver driver,
                                      java.lang.String buttonSelector,
                                      java.lang.String buttonText)
        Waits for the specified popup to appear and if it does, clicks on the specified button to close it
        Parameters:
        driver - current WebDriver browser instance
        buttonSelector - css selector to identify the popup dialog button
        buttonText - text of the button you want to click

      • getDBvalue

        public static java.lang.String getDBvalue(java.lang.String sqlQuery)
        Helper function that returns a value from the redcap database based on sql select query. The function assumes that your query is one that returns a single value only - it returns null if the query returns multiple rows. Best used for looking up specific info, e.g. the email address of a specific user
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - SQL SELECT statement to return a specific value from the REDCap database
        Returns:
        single value resulting from query or null if multiple rows are returned

      • echoDebug

        public static void echoDebug(java.lang.String str)
        Echoes debugging information to console
        Parameters:
        str - String printed to console

      • echoTestInfo

        public static void echoTestInfo(int flag,
                                java.lang.String str)
        Echoes informational messages on individual test progress to console
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag that's passed in from Test Class; Set to 1 to display message, 0 to suppress
        str - String printed to console
